statistical module¶

statistical.correlation(df)¶

[Get correlation matrix for a given Dataframe using Pearsons r.]

Parameters

df ([Dataframe]) – [DataFrame containing data to be correlated.]

Returns

[DataFrame representing the correlation matrix.]

Return type

[DataFrame]

statistical.del_below(df, threshhold)¶

[Takes a dataframe and checks the variance of the columns against a given threshhold, deletes IN PLACE if variance falls below threshhold.]

Parameters

  • df ([DataFrame]) – [DataFrame to be checked.]

  • threshhold ([Integer or Float]) – [Sets threshhold to check variance against.]

Returns

[DataFrame without the columns with variance below threshhold.]

Return type

[DataFrame]

statistical.get_columns(df, x, y)¶

[Take two columns from a DataFrame and put them into a seperate DataFrame.]

Parameters

  • df ([DataFrame]) – [DataFrame containing the columns to be extracted.]

  • x ([String]) – [Designates 1st column to be extracted.]

  • y ([String]) – [Designated 2nd column to be extracted.]

Returns

[DataFrame only constisting of the two designated columns.]

Return type

df_out ([DataFrame])

statistical.get_distance(vectors)¶

[Calculate the euclidian distance between two vectors, represented as columns in a DataFrame.]

Parameters

vectors ([DataFrame]) – [DataFrame containing the two columns representing the vectors.]

Returns

[Euclidian distance of the vectors.]

Return type

distance ([Float])

statistical.get_values(df, exclude)¶

[Extract values from correlation matrix.]

Parameters

  • df ([DataFrame]) – [Correlation Matrix.]

  • exclude ([String or Boolean]) – [Designated parameter which is not of interest and can be dropped. Set to False to keep all.]

Returns

[np.ndarray containing the values and information about what was correlated.]

Return type

array ([np.ndarray])

statistical.reduced(corr_matrix)¶

[Takes correlation matrix in form of DataFrame and sets lower triangular values and diagonal values to 0.]

Parameters

corr_matrix ([DataFrame]) – [Correlation matrix to be reduced.]

Returns

[Reduced correlation matrix.]

Return type

[DataFrame]

statistical.sort_values(array_in)¶

[Takes a np.ndarray containing N rows and 3 columns, sorts the rows by absolute value of the entry in the third column.]

Parameters

array_in ([np.ndarray]) – [Array containing the values of a correlation matrix.]

Returns

[Sorted array containing values of a correlation matrix.]

Return type

[np.ndarray]
